quote: I've got soul, but I'm not a souldier.
author: The Killers,  The Killers, Hot Fuss

quote: Soul inhabits body that fits.
author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: The soul is a prolonged anniversary of our lives in this world.
author: Sorin Cerin,  Wisdom Collection: The Book of Wisdom

quote: My soul hurts.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: There is more to a soul than what others see
author: Colleen Coble,  Fire Dancer

quote: I'm not a body with a soul, I'm a soul that has a visible part called the body.
author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes

quote: My soul is in the sky.
author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream

quote: You don’t have a soul, Doctor. You are a soul. You have a body, temporarily.
author: Walter M. Miller Jr.,  A Canticle for Leibowitz

quote: The soul is the weariest part of the body.
author: Paul Bowles,  The Sheltering Sky

quote: A soul gives power to the mind; and the mind empowers the soul
author: Jeremy Aldana

quote: Be strong in soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The soul is placed in the body like a rough diamond, and must be polished, or the luster of it will never appear.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: A soul that becomes the place where divine grace is harbored and encouraged joins the class of the immortals and lives on into eternal greatness.
author: Garey Gordon,  The Values Pursued Life: Excellence and Greatness from Within

quote: The soul ... has a slow and dark birth, more mysterious than the birth of the body. When the soul of a man is born in this country there are nets flung at it to hold it back from flight. You talk to me of nationality, language, religion. I shall try to fly by those nets.
author: James Joyce,  A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

quote: Good heart, good soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: It is with the soul that we grasp the essence of another human being, not with the mind, nor even with the heart.
author: Henry Miller

quote: What door is opened into soul through our wounds.
author: James Hillman

quote: The Soul selects her own Society.
author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems

quote: Your soul is the priestess of memory, selecting, sifting, and ultimately gathering your vanishing days toward presence.
author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom

quote: The soul who does not live to give the best, deny the sacred self of full strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
author: Plato

quote: My body is precious and not separate from my soul.
author: SARK,  Succulent Wild Woman

quote: Soul meets soul on lovers lips.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: A broken soul is not the absence of beauty, but a cracked and torn soul reeks of the sweet incense it contains.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Every book has a soul, the soul of the person who wrote it and the soul of those who read it and dream about it.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Angel's Game

quote: This is [her] soul group.’What do you mean?’It’s a group of souls with whom she resonates closely.
author: James Redfield,  The Tenth Insight: Holding the Vision

quote: I don't deserve a soul, yet I still have one. I know because it hurts.
author: Douglas Coupland,  The Gum Thief

quote: God steals my soul.
author: Harley King

quote: The soul exists partly in eternity and partly in time.
author: Marsilio Ficino

quote: Indomitable soul encompasses a beautiful heart and a beautiful smile.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The soul is a magician. Only living flesh hampers it.
author: Tanith Lee,  Death's Master

quote: The finest thing under the sun and moon is the human soul. I marvel at the small miracles of kindness that pass between humans, I marvel at the growth of conscience, at the persistence of reason in the face of all superstition or despair. I marvel at human endurance.
author: Anne Rice,  Pandora

quote: Body and spirit, I surrendered whole, To harsh Instructors- and received a soul.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The soul is an irrational, indivisible equation that perfectly expresses one thing: you. The soul would be no good to the devil if it could be destroyed. And it is not lost when placed in Satan's care, as is so often said. He always know exactly how to put his finger on it.
author: Joe Hill,  Horns

quote: It’s an already inside outside,The philosophers say it’s the soulBut it’s not the soul: it’s the animal or the man itselfIn its way of existing.
author: Alberto Caeiro,  The Collected Poems of Alberto Caeiro

quote: Death is the Graduation of the Soul
author: Sylvia Browne,  The Other Side and Back

quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quote: If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Your soul is oftentimes a battlefield, upon your reason and your judgment wage war against your passion and your appetite.
author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

quote: If I had a soul I sold itfor pretty wordsIf I had a body I usedit up spurting my essenceAllen Ginsberg warns youdont follow my pathto extinction
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Souls are like athletes, that need opponents worthy of them, if they are to be tried and extended and pushed to the full use of their powers, and rewarded according to their capacity.
author: Thomas Merton,  The Seven Storey Mountain

quote: A soul needs a purpose to live and so I concluded that my purpose was to kill everyone besides myself. I felt alive.--Gaara
author: Masashi Kishimoto

quote: Love ignites spiritual fire in the soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
author: Charles Bukowski,  Tales of Ordinary Madness

quote: My soul is invisible, like an anorexic’s dinner, but it sure enhances how I feel about my body.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: It is only through mystery and madness that the soul is revealed
author: Thomas Moore

quote: My soul left my body, and my body left my clothes and went streaking through the streets.
author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense

quote: The soul is like an uninhabited worldthat comes to life only whenGod lays His headagainst us.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: The supposedly immaterial soul, we now know, can be bisected with a knife, altered by chemicals, started or stopped by electricity, and extinguished by a sharp blow or by insufficient oxygen.
author: Steven Pinker,  How the Mind Works
